clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Information on Danish Workers With Low Back Pain.
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of an Educational Based Intervention on Danish Workers With Low Back Pain. A Randomized Controlled Single Blinded Study.

brief_summary.textblock: Randomized controlled study of the effect of an educational based intervention concerning low back pain on various self-reported outcomes eg. functional level, work ability, sick absence, pain level, usage of health services and beliefs about back pain.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Factorial Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Prevention

primary_outcome.description: Item 1 in the Work Ability Index current workability in present job 11 point scale
item 2 & 4 in Low Back Pain Bothersomeness Scale cathegoric variable/numeric variable

secondary_outcome.description: item 5 on LBP-BS days of sick leave within 4 weeks numeric variable

other_outcome.description: amount of monthly visits to any kind of health providers numeric continuant variable,
4 items from Back Beliefs Questionnaire measured at baseline and 5.5 months after baseline

arm_group.description: Lectures on scientific status on back pain, a folder and telephone acess to health professional

intervention.intervention_name: Lectures in scientific status on the back
intervention.description: Two lectures, a folder and possibility to contact health professional by telephone

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- employed
- either physically strenious work or deskjob
- employed at one of the participating municipal workplaces
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy within the first 6 months of the study
- psychiatric disease that has significant impact
- present cancer disease
- planned stop at the workplace within the first 6 months of the study
